H0.text: One mutated allele is needed for a person to be affected by an autosomal dominant disorder.

H1.text: Extra alleles are needed for a person to be affected by an autosomal dominant disorder.

H2.text: One less chromosome is needed for a person to be affected by an autosomal dominant disorder.

H3.text: One isolated allele is needed for a person to be affected by an autosomal dominant disorder.

A4.text: In genetics, dominance is the phenomenon of one variant (allele) of a gene on a chromosome masking or overriding the effect of a different variant of the same gene on the other copy of the chromosome.

A5.text: In complete dominance, the effect of one allele in a heterozygous genotype completely masks the effect of the other.
